title: Dormaahene to grace GFA/PLB Awards
text:
17:00 CET Dormaahene to grace GFA/PLB Awards By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 22, GNA - The Omanhene of the Dormaa Traditional Area, Osagyefo Oseadeeyo Agyemang Badu II, will be the Special Guest of Honour at 2015 Ghana Football Association (GFA) Premier League Board (PLB) First Capital Plus Awards Night, fixed for the La Palm Royal Beach Hotel, on Friday, October 30. 
Osagyefo Oseadeeyo Agyemang Badu II, who is the owner of former league champions Aduana Stars is expected to bring his rich royal presence at the event as well as deliver a speech on the night. 
The respected Dormahene, who is currently a patron of the Retired Footballers Association of Ghana (RENFAG) as well as the president of the Dormaa Traditional council, will be joined by great football personalities across the length and breadth of the country for the flagship event of the Ghana Football Association. 
In all over 20 individuals, clubs and corporate bodies will be honoured on the night. 
The Awards Ceremony instituted to reward and recognize players, officials and clubs who excelled in the 2014/15 edition of the First Capital Plus Premier League will see Berekum Chelsea's Kofi Owusu battling Wa All Stars's goalie Richard Ofori and defender Eric Opoku of AshantiGold FC for the topmost award of the night - the Footballer of the Season. 
GNA
